numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy applicants have more than double the admission advantage compared to non-legacy students.
2. Up to the 99.9 percentile, the graph is almost flat.
3. After the 99.9 percentile, the graph grows suddenly for legacy applicants.
4. After the 99.9 percentile, the graph grows suddenly for non-legacy applicants.
5. The 99.9 percentile of legacy applicants has more than 6 times the admission advantage compared to the average applicant.
6. The 99.9 percentile of non-legacy applicants has about the same admission advantage as poorer legacy applicants.
7. The 99.9 percentile of non-legacy applicants has less admission advantage than poorer legacy applicants.
8. I wonder why colleges value legacy students more than rich non-legacy students.
9. I wonder how the admission process differs for non-legacy applicants.
10. I wonder how the admission process differs for legacy applicants.
11. I wonder how the admission process differs for rich applicants.
12. I wonder how the admission process differs for poor applicants.
13. Many people think that going to college is an important determinant of a person's future.
14. I want to go to college.
15. These statistics can be discouraging for me.
16. If a person is not a legacy applicant then another person will be considered first in line no matter what the person does.
17. The headline is: Elite Colleges Have Preferences.
